Relations and Functions Problems.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5}, how many relations can be defined from A to B?
If A = {1, 2, 3}, what is the Cartesian product A × A?
Which of the following relations is reflexive?
A relation R on set A = {1, 2, 3} is said to be symmetric if:
options: If (a, b) ∈ R, then (b, a) ∈ R for all a, b ∈ A
If (a, a) ∈ R for all a ∈ A
If (a, b) ∈ R implies (b, a) ∉ R for all a, b ∈ A
If (a, b) ∈ R and (b, c) ∈ R, then (a, c) ∈ R
Relations and Functions Problems.correctAnswer: If (a, b) ∈ R, then (b, a) ∈ R for all a, b ∈ A

Relations and Functions Problems.question: Which of the following relations is transitive?
A relation that is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive is called:
The domain of the function f(x) = √(x − 2) is:
If f(x) = 2x + 3 and g(x) = x^2, what is (f ∘ g)(x)?
Which of the following functions is one-to-one (injective)?
A function f: A → B is onto (surjective) if:
options: Every element of B has a pre-image in A
Every element of A has an image in B
f(x) = f(y) for all x and y
Relations and Functions Problems.correctAnswer: Every element of B has a pre-image in A

Relations and Functions Problems.question: If f(x) = 3x + 1 and f −1(x) is its inverse, what is f −1(7)?
If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5, 6}, how many functions can be defined from A to B?
What is the range of the function f(x) = x^2 − 4 for x ∈ ℝ?
If f(x) = x^2 and g(x) = 2x + 1, what is (g ∘ f)(x)?
Which of the following is a bijection?
If a relation is both a partial order and an equivalence relation, it is:
What is the domain of the function f(x) = 1/x?
If f: A → B is a bijective function, which of the following is true?
options: Every element in A has a unique image in B and vice versa
Every element in A has multiple images in B
Every element in B has no image in A
No element in A has an image in B
Relations and Functions Problems.correctAnswer: Every element in A has a unique image in B and vice versa

Relations and Functions Problems.question: If f(x) = 3x + 2 and g(x) = x − 1, what is (f ∘ g)(x)?
If f(x) = x^2 and f: ℝ → [0, ∞), is f surjective?
Which of the following is not a function?
If f(x) = 4x − 1, find the inverse of the function.
Which of the following is an example of an equivalence relation?
options: Equality on set of real numbers
Less than on set of real numbers
Greater than on set of real numbers
Relations and Functions Problems.correctAnswer: Equality on set of real numbers

Relations and Functions Problems.question: If f(x) = |x|, is f injective?
The range of the function f(x) = e^x is:
If g(x) = 1/x, what is the domain of g?
If f(x) = 2x + 1 and f −1(x) = (x − 1)/2, what is f(f −1(5))?
What is the domain of the function f(x) = ln(x)?
Which of the following functions is neither injective nor surjective?
If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5}, how many one-to-one (injective) functions can be defined from A to B?
